0.Pros: Half off on meals, Free meal if working more than 6 hours, break every 2 hours. free drinks.
0.Cons: horrible customers, gross bathrooms, poor management, didn't offer direct deposit, inconvenient work hours ( I was in high school and college at time)

2.Pros: You get to Meet new people

3.Cons: rude managers , stingy with breaks, works long hours, lagging mangers, low wages

4.Pros: Good if your are in desperate need of money. Overall nice honest people working there, not gonna lie.
4.Cons: Good enough break time. Busy around lunch time, staff often don't pull their weight around here though.

5.Pros: You'll learn how to work in a very fast paced environment. My McDonald's had very few periods of calm even in off-hours. I had to learn how to multi-task and work efficiently. Also, I learned how to deal with a wide range of individuals with differing priorities: very wealthy or homeless; speedy delivery or accuracy over efficiency; some people even wanted me to slow down and focus on customer service itself. So it was interesting to learn how to treat each customer as a unique individual and focus on their needs.It's a repetitive job, but it can be rewarding when everyone is satisfied with their orders.
5.Cons: Some of the regulars would regularly forget that you were not a perfect robot.Since our breaks were all spread out in order to accommodate the customers, I didn't get to interact much with the other team members.There were a lot of Spanish-speaking or heavily accented individuals that I couldn't help but offend when I didn't understand them. Learning common Spanish words is very useful.

6.Pros: Great peopleAlot of hoursPays above minimum wageForward thankingFast pacedClean
6.Cons: Managers can choose favoritesFast pace can be tough when you first start

8.Cons: Lack of communication between super management and store level

9.Pros: The best benefits work the sabbaticals after 10 years of service and if you were a remote worker you most likely had a company car would you could use during your entire vacation at no cost to you. In addition to your sabbatical you could also have the option of adding your regular vacation time and if you lasted for 10 years you had 5 weeks of vacation.
9.Cons: I was a remote worker which allowed many freedoms but new leadership micromanaged.
